sense.name: utter a loud, piercing cry or communicate in such a voice
sense.examples: Samantha screamed in pain. The neighbors heard them screaming at each other for hours. "I hate you!" she screamed.

sense.name: create a loud, piercing sound
sense.examples: The planes screamed through the sky. Brakes screamed as she swerved to avoid the debris.

sense.name: strongly indicate a quality or identity
sense.examples: There was something in his demeanor that screamed desperation. Her clothes screamed back office drone. His plates said Iowa, but his accent screamed New York.
